chargeHist.descr: Battery to a Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery to a Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Logan R Top

records.addlTxt:
2:57 PM case called. Prosecuting attorney Angela Lynn Beranek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Logan R Top in court.  Attorney Carly June Sebion appeared by video for Logan R Top. 
There is an agreement. Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads Guilty to Counts 2 and 3 as charged in the Information. Court has colloquy with defendant regarding the DAGP agreement. 
Court accepts the defendants pleas but withholds a finding of Guilt and allows the defendant to enter into the 12 month DAGP offer with the State.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for May 24, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on May 24, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights (with Attachment)
Plea hearing on May 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea hearing on May 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Case called at 3:00 PM. Hearing held via Zoom and in person.
Defendant Logan R Top in court.  Attorney Carly June Sebion appeared by video for Logan R Top.  Attorney Trenton John Piltz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. 
Attorney Sebion requests a Plea Hearing 30 days out.
Plea Hearing: 5/10/22 at 9:30 AM.

1:38 PM Defendant Logan R Top appeared in court, Attorney Carly June Sebion for Logan R Top appeared by video, Attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing freely, voluntarily and with the advice of counsel. Court accepts waiver. Case referred to Br. 5 for arraignment.
Defendant's Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing

records.addlTxt:
Conditions:
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications or drug paraphernalia. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
Preliminary hearing on March 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defense waives reading of the Complaint. Defendant updates phone number. Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation.
